content.description: The management of a large hardware store is interested in estimating the difference between the mean dollar amount of purchases made by customers who use the store’s credit card and the mean dollar amount of purchases made by customers who use a different credit card. A random sample of 74 customers who used the store’s credit card showed a mean purchase of $107 with a standard deviation of $12. A separate random sample of 58 customers who used a different credit card showed a mean purchase of $132 with a standard deviation of $9. Technology was used to calculate that the correct number of degrees of freedom is 129.78.
content.question: Which of the following represents the margin of error for a 98 percent confidence interval to estimate the difference in the mean purchase amount for the two types of credit cards?

choices.label: <math alttext="2.355 times the square root of the fraction with numerator 12 squared, and denominator 74, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 9 squared, and denominator 58, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.355</mn><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>74</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>58</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2.355 times the square root of the fraction with numerator 12 squared plus 9 squared, and denominator 74 plus 58, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.355</mn><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>74</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>58</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2.326 times the square root of the fraction with numerator 12, and denominator 74, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 9, and denominator 58, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.326</mn><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>74</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>58</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2.326 times the square root of the fraction with numerator 12 squared plus 9 squared, and denominator 74 plus 58, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.326</mn><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>74</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>58</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2.326 times the square root of the fraction with numerator 12 squared, and denominator 74 end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 9 squared, and denominator 58, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.326</mn><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>74</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>58</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2.355 times the square root of the fraction with numerator 12 squared, and denominator 74, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 9 squared, and denominator 58, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.355</mn><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>74</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>58</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 7.6: Confidence Intervals for the Difference of Two Means

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Construct a confidence interval, provided conditions for inference are met.
